citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC)
citeinfo.title: Benthic Organisms Database

abstract.p: This file contains data from field sampling or surveys of bottom dwelling marine organisms. The data provide information on species abundance, distribution and biomass; they may have been collected by point sampling (grab or core), by tow (dredge, trawl, or net), by photographic surveys or by other methods. Number and weight of each species are reported.
The NODC taxonomic code is used to identify the benthic organisms. These data were collected by the Outer Continental Shelf Environmental Assessment Program.
The database consists of 26, 275 records. On-line documentation is available on the NOSIE system located on the NODC VAX computer and the NODC User's Guide.

descript.purpose: To provide a database of bottom dwelling organisms collected by the Outer Continental Shelf Environmental Assessment Program (OCSEAP).

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
